required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: CD19 CAR-T Cells for Patients With Relapse and Refractory CD19+ B-ALL.
clinical_study.official_title: Phase I Study of the Safety and Efficacy of CD19 CAR-T Cells in Patients With Relapsed or Refractory Acute B-cell Lymphoblastic Leukemia (R/R B-ALL)

lead_sponsor.agency: Tianjin Mycure Medical Technology Co., Ltd

clinical_study.source: Tianjin Mycure Medical Technology Co., Ltd

brief_summary.textblock: This is a single center, single arm, open-lable phase 1 study to determine the safety and efficacy of CD19-CAR-T cells in patients with relapsed or refractory acute B-cell lymphoblastic leukemia (R/R B-ALL).

detailed_description.textblock: In this single-center, open-label, nonrandomized, no control, prospective clinical trial, no less than 18 CD19+ B-cell relapsed or refractory acute B-cell lymphoblastic leukemia (R/R B-ALL) patients will be enrolled. Side effects of CD19 CAR T cells therapy will be monitored. The purpose of current study is to determine the clinical efficacy and safety of CD19 CAR T cells therapy in patients with R/R B-ALL.

study_design_info.intervention_model_description: single-center, open-label, nonrandomized, no control, prospective clinical trial

primary_outcome.description: Percentage of participants with adverse events

secondary_outcome.description: The percentage of participants who achieved complete remission (CR) over all participants (CRR).
The percentage of participants who achieved complete remission (CR) and partial remission over all participants (ORR).

arm_group.description: Subjects will receive CD19-CAR-T Cells on Day 0 : 100% of total dose.

intervention.description: T cells purified from the PBMC of subjects, transduced with 4-1BB/CD3-ζ lentiviral vector, expanded in vitro for future administration.

patient_data.ipd_description: We don't decide when to share IPD and what will be shared.
